info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 3:19PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Weld and northeastern Boulder Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 319 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Berthoud, or 21 miles south of Fort Collins, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Longmont, Firestone, Johnstown, Berthoud and Mead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
